QueryText: Asked about information on  organic farming
KccAns: SUGGESTED TO THE FARMER AS PER THE GUIDANCE UNDER THGE HORTICULTURE POPJeevamrutaIngredients10 kg. dung10 L. urine2 kg. black jaggery2 kg. bengal gram flour or any gram flourHandful of soil (field, paddy field or soil of garden bunds)175 L. waterRequired 250 L. of water storage capacity plastic drums or 175 L. cement tank, first add 10 kg dung followed by 2 kg jaggery, 2 kg gram flour and 10 L. of urine and soil.equired 250 L. of water storage capacity plastic drums or 175 L. cement tank, first add 10 kg dung followed by 2 kg jaggery, 2 kg gram flour and 10 L. of urine and soil.Cover the barrel / drum / cement tank containing jeevamruta with thin wet gunny bag and keep it under tree or shade. Stir the jeevamruta everyday morning and evening (two times in a day) with a stick.Once the jeevamruta prepared should be used within 9-12 days. While it is using to the land or spraying to the soil, sufficient moisture should be present in the soil. Jeevamruta should use in rainy day, higher moisture in the soil, while providing irrigation to the soil, morning due fall etc. Apply jeevamruta to the crops by giving irrigation through canal.

QueryText: Asked about Plant Protection in  CHILLI
KccAns: Leaf curl diseaseYellow mixed green leaves, the irregular leaf size with curled leaves, stunted growth of the plants. It is virus disease.Spray 2.5 ml. - 5 per cent garlic extraact + green chille extract + kerosine + neem based insecticides in a lit. water.Raise the seedlings in 40 mesh nylon netting.15 days after transplanting spray 1.0 ml. neem oil or 1.7 ml. Triazophos 40 EC.OR2.5 ml. Dicofol 18.5 EC.OR0.3 ml. Imidacloprid 17.8 SL./lit. water. Repeat the spray at an interval of 10 days, around 200 lit. spray solution/acre/spray.

QueryText: Asked about General information on banana
KccAns: suggested that Prepare the land by ploughing, harrowing and bring the soil to fine tilth.Dig the pits of 0.5 ft. length x 0.5 ft. breadth x 0.5 ft. depth at specified distance.Fertilizers for tissue culture banana to be given at : 35, 70, 105, 140, 175 days after planting (5 instalments).Do not allow any side suckers to grow till the main plant flower. At the time of flowering allow only one sucker for getting a ratoon crodiv.Apply the fertilizers in 3 split doses at 2, 4 and 6 months after planting.

QueryText: Asked about cultural practices of groundnut
KccAns: suggested that One deep ploughing, two light ploughings followed by harrowing. Apply 4 t of FYM for irrigated crop and 3 t of FYM for rainfed crop at the time of last ploughing.    Compost/FYM: Apply 4 (t/acre) under irrigated condition and 3 (t/acre) under rainfed condition.    Fertilizers: irrigated; 10: 30: 15 kg NPK/acre, rainfed: 10: 20: 10 NPK kg/acre.

QueryText: Asked about water management in banana
KccAns: Use the remaining soil to build a berm around the plant. Bananas need regualr watering to sustain the large tropical leaves and produce sweet tasty fruit. You should expect to water slowly and deeply every 2 or 3 days during the warmer months. A test when to water is when the top 1/2-1 inch of soil is dry.

QueryText: ASKED ABOUT NUTRIENT MANAGEMENT IN TURMERIC CROP
KccAns: At the time of field preparation, apply well decomposed cow dung@150 qtl/acre in soil. Apply N:P:K@10:10:10 kg/acre in form of Urea@25 kg/acre, SSP@60 kg/acre and MOP@16 kg/acre. Full dose of Potash and Phosphorus are applied at time of rhizome planting. Nitrogen dose is given in two equal splits. First half dose of N is given 75 days after planting and remaining half dose is given three month after planting.

QueryText: Asked about seedling preparation
KccAns: Raising SeedlingsPrepare 6 raised nursery beds of 22.5 feet long 3.5 feet wide and 4 inches high for raising seedlings for one acre.Apply 30 Kg FYM and 0.5 Kg 15: 15: 15 compound fertilizer per and mix them well in the soil.Treat seeds with 0.5 g. Marcury chloride dissolved in 0.5 litre of for 30 minutes. Dry them in shade.Sow the seeds on seed beds in 3 inches row on the beds cover them with soil.Provide shade during summer months till the seeds germinate.Irrigate the bed regularly, both in the morning and evening.The seedlings will be ready for transplanting in about four weeks.

QueryText: Asked about Weed management in sugarcane
KccAns: suggested that Spray the soil with 1 kg Atrazine 50% WP. or 1 kg Diuron 80% or 600 g. Metribuzin 70% WP /acre dissolved in 300 liters of water on 2 - 3 days after planting.Repeat the above spray at 25 days on weeds. These weedicides control wide leaf and cupreous weeds.Maintain fine soil tilth and optimum moisture in the soil at the time of spraying.Give 3 - 4 intercultivation and control the weeds.

QueryText: Asked about cultural practices of
KccAns: Transplanting    After the land is ready, convert the land into ridges and furrows at 3 ft. apart while CoVC. - 671 at 2.5 ft. rows. Keeping the depth of 6 - 8''.    Irrigate the field and plant the sets in the centre of the furrow preferably during dry weather. The high buds should always face side wards.    Wider method of planting in sugarcane    High tillering varieties Co - 62175 (Nayana) and Vishal are planted at 5 ft. rows on either side in the shape of jig- jag.    Saving up to 20% in transplanting, intercultivation and trash management and also soil improvement by adopting this method.

QueryText: Asked about Plant Protection
KccAns: Leaf curl diseaseYellow mixed green leaves, the irregular leaf size with curled leaves, stunted growth of the plants. It is virus disease.Spray 2.5 ml. - 5 per cent garlic extraact + green chille extract + kerosine + neem based insecticides in a lit. water.Raise the seedlings in 40 mesh nylon netting.15 days after transplanting spray 1.0 ml. neem oil or 1.7 ml. Triazophos 40 EC.OR2.5 ml. Dicofol 18.5 EC.OR0.3 ml. Imidacloprid 17.8 SL./lit. water. Repeat the spray at an interval of 10 days, around 200 lit. spray solution/acre/spray.

QueryText: Asked about water management   in sugarcane
KccAns: Water managementIrrigate the crop once in 8 days in sandy loam soils and once in 15 days black soils depending upon the weather conditions.When there is shortage of water during summer apply sugarcane trash mulch at 3 t./acre after final earthing up.Application of 25% higher potash will overcome water constraints and also improve the quality of the sugarcane juice.

QueryText: Asked about Plant Protection in    chilli
KccAns: Leaf curl diseaseYellow mixed green leaves, the irregular leaf size with curled leaves, stunted growth of the plants. It is virus disease.Spray 2.5 ml. - 5 per cent garlic extraact + green chille extract + kerosine + neem based insecticides in a lit. water.Raise the seedlings in 40 mesh nylon netting.15 days after transplanting spray 1.0 ml. neem oil or 1.7 ml. Triazophos 40 EC.OR2.5 ml. Dicofol 18.5 EC.OR0.3 ml. Imidacloprid 17.8 SL./lit. water. Repeat the spray at an interval of 10 days, around 200 lit. spray solution/acre/spray.

QueryText: Asked about pruning of mango
KccAns: Mango crop is having compact branching, by thinning the branches encourages the movement of sunlight and aeration there by encourages by the fruit set and improves the quality of fruits.When mango plants are 5 - 6 years of age, 1 or 2 central branches of mango plant can be thinned out which encourage the sunlight. Other branches can be thinned out subsequently.Smearing of fungicide and insecticide is essential.June - July is suitable time for pruning mango after harvesting the mango crodiv.

QueryText: ASKED ABOUT TURMERIC RHIZOMES TREATMENT
KccAns: PlantingPrepare the land by ploughing and harrowing and bring it to fine tilth.Apply the entire quantity of farm yard manure at the time of ploughing and mix it well in the soil.Prepare beds of convenient size 30 feet apart.Plant the rhizome at 1.5 feet rows at a distance of 1 feet of apart.Treat the rhizomes with 0.3% Mancozeb or 3 gm Captan, 0.5 gm Streptocycline, 2 ml Chloropyriphos in  1 litre water. Dip the rhizomes 4 to 8 hours before planting.

QueryText: Asked about Weed management in SUGARCANE
KccAns: Recommended to  Weed managementSpray the soil with 1 kg Atrazine 50% WP. or 1 kg Diuron 80% or 600 g. Metribuzin 70% WP /acre dissolved in 300 liters of water on 2 - 3 days after planting.Repeat the above spray at 25 days on weeds. These weedicides control wide leaf and cupreous weeds.Maintain fine soil tilth and optimum moisture in the soil at the time of spraying.Give 3 - 4 intercultivation and control the weeds.

QueryText: Asked about  Sowing season in ginger
KccAns: PlantingPrepare the land by ploughing and harrowing.Apply the entire dose of farm yard manure or compost before ploughing. Prepare raised beds of 9 to 15 feet length, 3 feet width.Plant the rhizome (15 - 20 gm weight) at 1 feet spacing in the beds.Treat the rhizomes 2 gm bleaching powder, 1 gm Metalaxyl MZ- 72, 1 gm Streptocycline and 2 ml Endosulfyl mixed in 1 ltr of water. Treat the rhizomes 30 minutes and dry in shade.This will prevent rhizome rot and scale insects problems.After the land is ready apply the entire dose of P and 50% K and mix them well. Plant rhizomes in 1 feet rows 12 inch apart. Apply 50% N 40 days after planting and the remaining 50% N and 50% K 60 to 70 days after planting.

QueryText: ASKED ABOUT NUTRIENT MANAGEMENT IN MAIZE
KccAns: Nutrient managementApply 20 kg nitrogen, 30 kg phosphorous and 16 kg potash fertilizers before sowing.Apply 40 kg. nitrogen as topdressing at 3 - 4 weeks after sowing in black soils.In red sand mixed soils, apply 20 kg nitrogen after 3 - 4 weeks after sowing and again 20 kg nitrogen at 6 - 7 weeks after sowing as topdressing.Apply the fertilizers 3 - 4'' away from seedlings with ring method of placement.Remove the tillers emerging from bottom of the plants.

QueryText: Asked about cultural practices  in Ridge gourd
KccAns: VarietiesSowing timeSpacing(feet)Seeds (kg/acre)Yield (tons/acre)Pusa Nasdar, Selection 4 - 12,Arka Sujatha,Arka Sumith,Pusa HybridJune-July and January-February 4 x 31.4 - 1.63 - 4Special charactersPusa Nasdar : Fruits are round with light green colour.Selcetion 4-12 : Fruits are long and yields 20% higher than local variety.Arka Sujatha :Fruits are medium long with dark green in colour.It has good aroma, soft with good cooking quality.Arka Sumith :Fruits are long and dark green in colour.Fruits are soft and having good aroma.Pusa Hybrid :Fruits are long with dark green in colour.Tolerant to powdery mildew.

KccAns: Leaf curl diseaseYellow mixed green leaves, the irregular leaf size with curled leaves, stunted growth of the plants. It is virus disease.Spray 2.5 ml. - 5 per cent garlic extraact + green chille extract + kerosine + neem based insecticides in a lit. water.Raise the seedlings in 40 mesh nylon netting.15 days after transplanting spray 1.0 ml. neem oil or 1.7 ml. Triazophos 40 EC.OR2.5 ml. Dicofol 18.5 EC.OR0.3 ml. Imidacloprid 17.8 SL./lit. water. Repeat the spray at an interval of 10 days, around 200 lit. spray solution/acre/spray.

KccAns: Nutrition Management Farm yard manure (tons/acre)Chemical fertilizers (kg/acre)12N : P : K80: 20 : 20 (Singles)80: 60 : 60 (Doubles)Fertilizer managementApply N : P : K : 40: 20: 20 for singels and N : P : K : 80: 60: 60 kg per acre for doubles.Apply 50% Nitrogen and of entire quantity of recommended Phosphorus and Potash mix in the soil.Remaining 50% of Nitrogen applied 6 weeks after transplanting.Remove the weeds and earth up the crop.Ratoon cropAfter the harvest of the main crop the flower stalks are headed back and the plot is manured and irrigated.About 3 - 4 ratoon crops can be taken from single planting.

QueryText: asked about control of  root grubs in sugarcane
KccAns: Suggested After April - May rain collect the adult beetles during evening hour.Deep repeated ploughing during JuneIncorporate 5 kg. Phorate 10 G/acre to the soil when soil moisture in optimum condition.If planted crop with severe infestation with root grubs, discourage ratooning.If the crop is infested and harvested in the month of September, if water available puddle the soil.If water available in root grubs infested areas mix 0.4 ml.Chlorpyriphos 20 EC. /m2 through irrigation water.

QueryText: Asked about sowing season &  Nutrient management of  cotton
KccAns: Nutrient managementIrrigated cotton-  sowing season : may - july  Recommended to Apply 50% nitrogen ( 30 kg), entire phosphorous ( 30 kg) and potash ( 30 kg) fertilizers at the time of sowing. QueryText: Asked about General information on pradhan mantri krishi samman nidhi yojana
KccAns: suggested that With a view to provide income support to all land holding eligible farmer families, the Government has launched PM-KISAN. The scheme aims to supplement the financial needs of the farmers in procuring various inputs to ensure proper crop health and appropriate yields, commensurate with the anticipated farm income.

QueryText: Asked about Nutrient management in maize
KccAns: Apply 20 kg nitrogen, 30 kg phosphorous and 16 kg potash fertilizers before sowing.Apply 40 kg. nitrogen as topdressing at 3 - 4 weeks after sowing in black soils.In red sand mixed soils, apply 20 kg nitrogen after 3 - 4 weeks after sowing and again 20 kg nitrogen at 6 - 7 weeks after sowing as topdressing.Apply the fertilizers 3 - 4'' away from seedlings with ring method of placement.Remove the tillers emerging from bottom of the plants.

QueryText: Asked about cultural practices  in
KccAns: PlantingPrepare the land by ploughing and harrowing and bring it to fine tilth.Apply the entire quantity of farm yard manure at the time of ploughing and mix it well in the soil.Prepare beds of convenient size 30 feet apart.Plant the rhizome at 1.5 feet rows at a distance of 1 feet of apart.Treat the rhizomes with 0.3% Mancozeb or 3 gm Captan, 0.5 gm Streptocycline, 2 ml Chloropyriphos in  1 litre water. Dip the rhizomes 4 to 8 hours before planting.

QueryText: Asked about Weed management in    MAIZE
KccAns: Weed managementSandy soils: Spray the soil on the same day or 1 day after sowing with 1 kg Atrazine 50% W.div. or 1 liter Pendimithalin 35%E.C. or 170 ml. Oxyfluorfen 23.5% E.C/ acre dissolved in 300 liters of water.Black soils: Spray the soil within 3 days after sowing with 1.2 kg Atrazine 50% Wp.or 1 liter Pendimithalin 35% E.C. or 170 ml.Oxyfluorfen 23.5% E.C/ acre dissolved in 300 liters of water.The soil should be fine tilth at the time of spray, do not trample the soil after spraying, there should be sufficient moisture in the soil.Most of the dicot and monocot weeds propagated by seeds are controlled.Intercultivate the crop 3 times, 15 days after sowing at 10 days interval.

QueryText: ASKED ABOUT NUTRIENT MANAGEMENT IN MAIZE
KccAns: RECOMMENDED TO APPLY  DAP 45 Kg, POTASH 30 kg as a basal dose and after 35 to 40 days apply urea 35 kg per acre.

QueryText: Asked about Nutrient management
KccAns: Fertilizer managementFollow the same fertilizers as suggested for the main crop.Apply 30% nitrogen and entire phosphorous and potash fertilizers at 30 days after harvesting of rotoon crop.Apply 35% nitrogen at 60 days and remaining 35% nitrogen fertilizer @ 90 days for rotoon crop.Apply the nitrogen in ploughed rows on either side of ridges and furrows or surrounding rotoon seedlings at 4 - 5'' depth and cover with soil.

QueryText: Asked about Plant protection
KccAns: After April - May rain collect the adult beetles during evening hour.Deep repeated ploughing during JuneIncorporate 5 kg. Phorate 10 G/acre to the soil when soil moisture in optimum condition.If planted crop with severe infestation with root grubs, discourage ratooning.If the crop is infested and harvested in the month of September, if water available puddle the soil.If water available in root grubs infested areas mix 0.4 ml.Chlorpyriphos 20 EC. /m2 through irrigation water.

QueryText: asked about nutrient management of sugarcane.

QueryText: asked about stevia plant cultural practices
KccAns: The small tubular flowers have five white petals and are borne in terminal clusters; the flowers are usually removed to improve the flavour of the leaves.
